item.description:
Now in its fifth year, and being shown at the Wadsworth for the first time, The Short Short Story Film Festival is a competitive international festival of films that each tell a story within five minutes.

From mini-documentaries to sentimental melodramas to black comedies to animated horror, the festival features succinct presentations of all kinds of short film stories.

The first program, called the “Heartstrings Program,” consists of films of a sentimental nature – tragic, comic, romantic, or a mix of the three.

The second, the “Headtrip Program,” presents weirder or darker films, from black comedies to thrillers to films that defy easy categorization.

The competitive international travelling film festival event includes audience voting for both programs along with a reception with film discussion and DJ Madame B mixing soundscapes.
